oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cannon ball
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Possibly a solid shot cannon ball from a 6 pounder cannon. The smaller 6 pound cannon were on the decline by the outbreak of the Civil War as the harder hitting 12 pound "Napoleon" rapidly replaced the lighter artillery piece. The use of the term "pound" or "pounder" refernces the approximate weight of the solid shot cannon ball fired from the respective guns. Although on the decline, some 6 pounders remained in use by the Confederates until the last days of the war.
